TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit CalendarContract/EventsColumns extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Columns from the Events table that other tables join into themselves.

remarks.para: Columns from the Events table that other tables join into themselves.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.EventsAccess AccessConfidential = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Provider.EventsAccess enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Confidential is not used by the app.

remarks.para: Confidential is not used by the app.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.EventsAccess AccessDefault = (0)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Provider.EventsAccess enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Default access is controlled by the server and will be treated as public on the device.

remarks.para: Default access is controlled by the server and will be treated as public on the device.

Docs.summary: Defines how the event shows up for others when the calendar is shared.

remarks.para: Defines how the event shows up for others when the calendar is shared. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (One of , ...)

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.EventsAccess AccessPrivate = (2)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Provider.EventsAccess enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Private shares the event as a free/busy slot with no details.

remarks.para: Private shares the event as a free/busy slot with no details.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.EventsAccess AccessPublic = (3)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Provider.EventsAccess enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Public makes the contents visible to anyone with access to the calendar.

remarks.para: Public makes the contents visible to anyone with access to the calendar.

Docs.summary: Is the event all day (time zone independent).

remarks.para: Is the event all day (time zone independent). Column name.
Type: INTEGER (boolean)

Docs.summary: If this event counts as busy time or is still free time that can be scheduled over.

remarks.para: If this event counts as busy time or is still free time that can be scheduled over. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (One of , , )

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.EventsAvailability AvailabilityBusy = (0)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Provider.EventsAvailability enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Indicates that this event takes up time and will conflict with other events.

remarks.para: Indicates that this event takes up time and will conflict with other events.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.EventsAvailability AvailabilityFree = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Provider.EventsAvailability enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Indicates that this event is free time and will not conflict with other events.

remarks.para: Indicates that this event is free time and will not conflict with other events.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Provider.EventsAvailability AvailabilityTentative = (2)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Provider.EventsAvailability enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Indicates that the owner's availability may change, but should be considered busy time that will conflict.

remarks.para: Indicates that the owner's availability may change, but should be considered busy time that will conflict.

Docs.summary: The of the calendar the event belongs to.

remarks.para: The of the calendar the event belongs to. Column name.
Type: INTEGER

Docs.summary: Whether the user can invite others to the event.

remarks.para: Whether the user can invite others to the event. The GUESTS_CAN_INVITE_OTHERS is a setting that applies to an arbitrary guest, while CAN_INVITE_OTHERS indicates if the user can invite others (either through GUESTS_CAN_INVITE_OTHERS or because the user has modify access to the event). Column name.
Type: INTEGER (boolean, readonly)

Docs.summary: The package name of the custom app that can provide a richer experience for the event.

remarks.para: The package name of the custom app that can provide a richer experience for the event. See the ACTION TYPE for details. Column name.
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: The URI used by the custom app for the event.

remarks.para: The URI used by the custom app for the event. Column name.
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: The description of the event.

remarks.para: The description of the event. Column name.
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: This will be if it is not null; otherwise, this will be .

remarks.para: This will be if it is not null; otherwise, this will be . Read-only value. To modify, write to or directly.
Type: INTEGER

Docs.summary: The time the event ends in UTC millis since epoch.

remarks.para: The time the event ends in UTC millis since epoch. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (long; millis since epoch)

Docs.summary: The time the event starts in UTC millis since epoch.

remarks.para: The time the event starts in UTC millis since epoch. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (long; millis since epoch)

Docs.summary: The duration of the event in RFC2445 format.

remarks.para: The duration of the event in RFC2445 format. Column name.
Type: TEXT (duration in RFC2445 format)

Docs.summary: A secondary color for the individual event.

remarks.para: A secondary color for the individual event. This should only be updated by the sync adapter for a given account.
Type: INTEGER

Docs.summary: A secondary color key for the individual event.

remarks.para: A secondary color key for the individual event. NULL or an empty string are reserved for indicating that the event does not use a key for looking up the color. The provider will update automatically when a valid key is written to this column. The key must reference an existing row of the table. @see Colors
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: The timezone for the end time of the event.

remarks.para: The timezone for the end time of the event. Column name.
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: Where the event takes place.

remarks.para: Where the event takes place. Column name.
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: The timezone for the event.

remarks.para: The timezone for the event. Column name.
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: The recurrence exception dates for the event.

remarks.para: The recurrence exception dates for the event. Column name.
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: The recurrence exception rule for the event.

remarks.para: The recurrence exception rule for the event. Column name.
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: Whether guests can invite other guests.

remarks.para: Whether guests can invite other guests. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (boolean)

Docs.summary: Whether guests can modify the event.

remarks.para: Whether guests can modify the event. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (boolean)

Docs.summary: Whether guests can see the list of attendees.

remarks.para: Whether guests can see the list of attendees. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (boolean)

Docs.summary: Whether the event has an alarm or not.

remarks.para: Whether the event has an alarm or not. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (boolean)

Docs.summary: Whether the event has attendee information.

remarks.para: Whether the event has attendee information. True if the event has full attendee data, false if the event has information about self only. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (boolean)

Docs.summary: Whether the event has extended properties or not.

remarks.para: Whether the event has extended properties or not. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (boolean)

Docs.summary: Are we the organizer of this event.

remarks.para: Are we the organizer of this event. If this column is not explicitly set, the provider will return 1 if is equal to . Column name.
Type: STRING

Docs.summary: The last date this event repeats on, or NULL if it never ends.

remarks.para: The last date this event repeats on, or NULL if it never ends. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (long; millis since epoch)

Docs.summary: Used to indicate that a row is not a real event but an original copy of a locally modified event.

remarks.para: Used to indicate that a row is not a real event but an original copy of a locally modified event. A copy is made when an event changes from non-dirty to dirty and the event is on a calendar with set to 1. This copy does not get expanded in the instances table and is only visible in queries made by a sync adapter. The copy gets removed when the event is changed back to non-dirty by a sync adapter.
Type: INTEGER (boolean)

Docs.summary: Email of the organizer (owner) of the event.

remarks.para: Email of the organizer (owner) of the event. Column name.
Type: STRING

Docs.summary: The allDay status (true or false) of the original recurring event for which this event is an exception.

remarks.para: The allDay status (true or false) of the original recurring event for which this event is an exception. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (boolean)

Docs.summary: The of the original recurring event for which this event is an exception.

remarks.para: The of the original recurring event for which this event is an exception. Column name.
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: The original instance time of the recurring event for which this event is an exception.

remarks.para: The original instance time of the recurring event for which this event is an exception. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (long; millis since epoch)

Docs.summary: The _sync_id of the original recurring event for which this event is an exception.

remarks.para: The _sync_id of the original recurring event for which this event is an exception. The provider should keep the original_id in sync when this is updated. Column name.
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: The recurrence dates for the event.

remarks.para: The recurrence dates for the event. Column name.
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: The recurrence rule for the event.

remarks.para: The recurrence rule for the event. Column name.
Type: TEXT

Docs.summary: This is a copy of the attendee status for the owner of this event.

remarks.para: This is a copy of the attendee status for the owner of this event. This field is copied here so that we can efficiently filter out events that are declined without having to look in the Attendees table. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (int)

Docs.summary: The event status.

remarks.para: The event status. Column name.
Type: INTEGER (one of ...)
